nav.div: Renaissance Academy Charter School » For Parents » Coronavirus (COVID-19) RA Information & Resources » Plans for Learning

span.strong: Renaissance Academy - Plans for Learning (updated April 3, 2020)

div.p: The Following Framework will be in place upon the return from Spring Break
Emails sent to parents on Fridays for the upcoming week’s assignments.

ul.li: One Kinder Roots Book per week
One Language Arts Assignment & four journal entries per week
One Math assignment per day
One OPTIONAL Science and Social Studies activity per week
All grades will be placed in the classwork category.

Fine Arts - rotation of graded vs. optional assignments each week. The fine arts week at a glance will note which assignments are graded and which ones are optional. Graded assignments will be given classwork grades. Optional assignments will continue to receive PBIS points. No student will ever have more than 2-3 graded fine arts assignments per week.
Google Meets will be used for reading and check-ins with the students (not mandatory but highly suggested) at teacher discretion.

div.p: Emails sent to parents Sunday Evenings for the upcoming week.

ul.li: One Math assignment on Pearson, daily
Reading is assigned weekly following suggested scope for each day for pacing.
Social Studies or Science one reading assignment with questions, weekly
Online formal assessments using Pearson assessments for Math and ELA.
First grade online assessments in the Social Studies curriculum.
Second-grade performance-based assessments.

Fine Arts - rotation of graded vs. optional assignments each week. The fine arts week at a glance will note which assignments are graded and which ones are optional. Graded assignments will be given classwork grades. Optional assignments will continue to receive PBIS points. No student will ever have more than 2-3 graded fine arts assignments per week.
Google hangouts will be used in a variety of ways to engage students with one another. This platform is not used for instruction.

div.p: Lessons posted in Google Classroom at the beginning of each week.

ul.li: One assignment for Math, ELA, and Science/Social Studies, daily.
Each assignment should take approximately 20-30 minutes to complete.
Some assignments may span 2-3 days.
Formal assessments will continue in the same format that was followed during the rest of the school year.
Fine Arts - One graded assignment weekly

div.p: Weekly work agendas will come via email to parents/guardians on Mondays.

ul.li: ELA and Math, daily assignments.
Science and Social Science two to three, assignments per week depending on the rotation.
ELA and Math will start weekly formal assessments starting the week of April 20th.
Social Studies formal assessments will be a short quiz that will be given weekly.
Science will have one more formal assessment after spring break. Once completed, all other work will be under the classwork category.
Fine Arts - One graded assignment weekly

div.p: Weekly work expectations for the week will come via email to parents/guardians on Mondays from Principal, Michelle Boyd.
Google Classroom posting of assignments for students.
No midweek surprises or additions of required work.

ul.li: Max of 2 assignments per subject area, per week, at no more than 2 hours of work.
Fine Art Classes - Max or 1 assignment per week, at no more than 11/2 hours of work.

div.p: Assignments posted in Google Classroom on Mondays.
No midweek surprises or additions of required work.

ul.li: AP Classes - Max of 3 assignments per week, at no more than 3 hours of work. *Optional additional activities and assignments per student choice.
Honors Classes - Max of 3 assignments per week, at no more than 3 hours of work.
On-Level Classes - Max of 2 assignments per week, at no more than 2 hours of work.
Fine Art Classes - Max or 1 assignment per week, at no more than 11/2 hours of work.

span.strong: Filed with the PA Department of Education:

a.title: Continuity of Education Plan - COVID-19 Mandatory Closure (pdf)

span.a: Continuity of Education Plan - COVID-19 Mandatory Closure (pdf)

div.p: The Renaissance Academy is committed to ensuring that all information placed on its website is accessible to individuals with disabilities. If you have a disability and the format of any material on our website interferes with your ability to access the information, please Visit our Accessibility Page for assistance.
